newsitem.title: USA: Duke McGuire 1 S.C. nuke back at full power.
newsitem.headline: Duke McGuire 1 S.C. nuke back at full power.

text.p: Duke Power Co's 1,129 megawatt McGuire nuclear power unit 1 was operating at full power Tuesday, returning from an outage that began Oct 31, Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said.
The Cornelius, N.C., unit was running at 100 percent production as of early Tuesday, NRC said in its daily plant status report.
McGuire 1 and the adjacent 1,129 megawatt McGuire unit 2 were shut after one of the facility's four backup battery banks failed to meet performance criteria during a test.
McGuire unit 2 was operating at six percent of capacity as of early Tuesday and was "holding due to a turbine problem," the NRC said in the report.
Separately, Duke's Oconee nuclear facility in Seneca, S.C. remains shut following a steam pipe rupture in September that injured seven employees.
No restart date has been set for the Oconoee units.
The three Oconee power units have the capacity to produce a combined total of 2,538 megawatts of electricity.
